name: 1000013-12_angry_men
review: This masterpiece was Sidney Lumet's first foray into directing and what a debut it was. This classic takes place in only one room, with only twelve actors (hence 12 Angry Men). I was riveted throughout and was wrapped up in Henry Fonda's performance. A film that any movie buff should own.

name: vertigo
review: Vertigo is another proof of Hitchcock's greatness and a solid psychological thriller that never fails to shock and scare, with mesmerizing lead performances and filled with plot-twists. Rightfully considered one of the best movies ever made, this timeless classic remain unsurpassed to this day.

name: vertigo
review: A tragic character study of dealing with death and obsession, Hitchcock's surreal magnum opus stands the test of time and should be watched by all film fanatics.

name: vertigo
review: Vertigo: Alfred Hitchcock's essentric masterpiece that dives on love and loss all while being scary and thrilling.

name: vertigo
review: There is something special about this film, and it is mainly its unconventionally predictable as well as unexpectedly contorted subject. This movie represents many peoples idea of mystery probably in the best way ever seen on screen.

name: vertigo
review: The best Hitchcock/Stewart collaboration ever, and one of Hitchcock's finest overall. Spellbinding story, and innovative camera effects - the first time to use the simultaneous zoom in/zoom out method to elicit the sensation of vertigo.

name: vertigo
review: All I can say is ...masterpiece. perfection. iconic. If you have never experienced this film do yourself a favor and watch it immediately.

name: vertigo
review: Hitchcock expertly tells a story about distance, the deep yearning for a connection that is too far away to obtain and is further shrouded by fears and former obligations. The viewer too feels this great longing long after the credits rolls.

review: Pretty much a perfect movie. Great look, great cast, great story, great mood. One of those 'if you don't like this, you don't like movies' movies. Roger Ebert put it best: "It is about a town with no reason to exist, and people with no reason to live there. The only hope is in transgression."

name: the_rules_of_the_game

name: the_rules_of_the_game

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: Perfect, the ultimate movie. Far too dense to absorb. Every role, every movement, every element of stage, every breath, evey word, eveything has a purpose. The equal of citizen Kane if not superior, really amazing.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: Superb comedy of class, manners, behavior. Fine performances. People who like Gosford Park (and Robert Altman films in general) will get a lot out of this one.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: One of the BEST films ever made. period.

name: the_rules_of_the_game

review: A masterful microcosm of Europe on the brink of cultural collapse

name: the_rules_of_the_game

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: A great movie to revisit at any time - on the grandness and pettiness of love, friendship, and human emotions in general. Unforgettable characters. Jean Renoir is great for an actor, too, not only for a director! Can't believe it's from 1939 - beats anything I've seen from the new century...

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: It's better every time you see it, especially with all the extras in the Criterion Edition.

name: the_rules_of_the_game

name: the_rules_of_the_game

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: I remember this film. Saw it way back in College.. FAntastic. ..Now I want to see it again. Renoir--sheer genious

name: the_rules_of_the_game

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: This wonderful film is lucky to still be intact after bannings by the French government and burnings of all available copies by the Nazis. That being said, the movie explores the tense relationships between lovers and friends in the pre-War French high society.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: Es tan espectacular que hay que verlo para creerlo. Todo es innegablemente excelente, obra maestra de obras maestras. Sin palabras.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: Fantastic movie. A must see if you have not done so yet. Picks apart the upper classes and caused a ton of controversy. A must see, I don't know how much more I can stress that.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: Classic Renoir. Nuff' said.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: I know the film is about the French pre-war aristocracy, but I loved what it had to say about love, lust, and friendship, and how often they can be concealed or confused.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: A great movie for those who love movies. One of the first films ever shot it depth, Rules of the Game is technically far ahead of its time. Beyond that, the characters are well developed, and the implication of montage shows the tension of pre-WWII France as the war draws nearer.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: One of the Cinema's most historically significant and most controversial works is an outstanding irreverent satire of bourgeois sensibilities from the master Renoir.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: Considered one of the greatest films of all time. Jean Renoir

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: Like "Gosford Park"? See where it came from here. So much going on in this film, you could watch it ten times and see something new each viewing.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: Renoir famously said 'Everybody has their reasons'. This, his most encompassing film, reconciles his obsession with deep staging and focus with his empathy and love for people caught up in their messy lives and problems. Humanist cinemas towering masterpiece.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: This really is the film you can watch over and over and over and keep seeing it as fresh as ever. At least that's how I feel after my fifth viewing. Renoir's films invite you into them - they build walls that set you free to roam within their interiors to discover layers of humanity.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: Qu'est-ce tu veux mon vieux, aujourd'hui tout le monde ment...!

name: the_rules_of_the_game

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: A rule-breaking, jaw-dropping fabulous comedy; a whirling, seething, absolutely scathing look at the French upper class, running pell-mell like lemmings into the sea. One of the greatest, darkest comedies ever made.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: A masterpiece of understatement and half-expressed emotion, with a lot of colorful and interesting characters put through their paces in a narrative that doesn't force anything.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: Great dark comedy. Highly recommended.

name: the_rules_of_the_game

review: Vicious and biting, yet somehow still oh so funny, The Rules of the Game is one of the best social critiques on film. Renoir goes right for the throat of the oblivious upper class, and he tears their jugular right out. A classic.

review: Jean Renoir's 1939 masterpiece is still the most humorous film of any decade. Think of it as a caustically hilarious documentary of the discreet charm of the bourgeoisie.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: Two words: Jean Renoir. No one expresses the inherent bittersweet beauty of the human condition better.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: Terrific. Of course.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: Jean Renoir (son of the Impressionist painter, Auguste) transforms film into art with this movie. Robert Altman borrowed heavily from "La Regle..." for his movie "Gosford Park" (also fantastic). An acute observation of the upstairs/downstairs world of high society 1930s France.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: Renoir is the bestest.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: This is one of the many important Renoir masterpieces. Dude was a true rebel.

name: the_rules_of_the_game

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: The original upstairs, downstairs examination. The sheer depth of material that Renoir is able to capture in his long takes is mighty impressive. As is the dramatic but still inherently complex emotionally honest lives of the film's many characters.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: Why does PT Anderson love Renoir so much? Well look at how much he takes from him (excluding There Will be Blood). The fluidity of movement and space in this film is just off the charts. Engaging to watch.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: So widely (and wisely) praised now that it's tempting to resist iconoclastically, but this is really a wonderful movie. Notice the incredible use of countryside footage - fields and grasses and grounds. This film looks like no other. It's set and filmed like no other. It's so unspeakably gorgeous.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: This film gets every character right and has to be one of the first to make full use of cinema's possibilities for using space to tell a story.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: Another one of those films that is considered among the 'best of all time' that actually lives up to hype. Visually this has to be one of the most sophisticated films ever, but it is never showy or obvious.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: pretty much a perfect film.

name: the_rules_of_the_game

review: The movie where Jean Renoir explore the sequence plan and the image great gray scale to tell us a modern 1939 fable about love, jealousy and death between a noble married couple: he is a French man and she is a German woman.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: Absolutely perfect in every way. I've watched it dozens of times over the course of my life and find new things to admire in it every time. If this rating system allowed ten stars, that's what I'd award it. Or thirty. Or a hundred.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: Almost 80 years old and still standing the test of time. Little known film (outside of critical studies circles) and should be seen by anyone who gets a chance.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: Not only a satire on the upper-class, but a full-on indictment of the facades of human nature. "Is it a comedy, or is it a tragedy? Either way, it's a masterpiece."

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: The grandaddy of all those rich-Europeans-gather-at-someone's-estate -for-the-weekend movies. Very funny, very tender and very tragic, this has lots to say about life, love and human folly. Should be required viewing for anyone with a heart.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: this film really stands up to all the critical praise. a wild romp through the french aristocracy circa 1939. renoir's classic is hilarious, meticulously filmed, thoughtfully scripted, and ultimately heartbreaking. this is one of the greats.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: paul schrader considers this the film without which there can possibly be no 'film canon.' i whole-heartedly concur. a brilliant, moving, hilarious and painful film, featuring great performances, great photography, and wonderful dialogue.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: A Comedy From France? No. The French can't do comedy--not from the same country where Sartre was born. This is a farce-- It hurts to laugh and that was Renoir's point.

name: the_rules_of_the_game
review: An almost perfect mess of drawing-room farce and biting social comment from master director Renoir (son of Auguste). The hunt scene has to be seen to be believed.

name: the_rules_of_the_game

name: the_rules_of_the_game

review: Classic, influential, funny, tragic, and just perfect.

name: the_rules_of_the_game

name: la_grande_illusion
review: The best foreign film I've watched, thus far. Its so good that writing a review would take too much time, but let me just say this: This is a film EVERY person should watch and a film that will still be important a CENTURY from now.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Erich von Stroheim was as always superb in this movie. Thank you Jean Renoir for this beautiful film with such a great message.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: One of the most crucial and humanist of films.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Simple yet emotionally complex. An anti-war story about patriotism, war, brotherhood and humanity. La Grande Illusion served as an influence to many future filmmakers dealing with the topic of war. Sad, funny and moving all at once!

name: la_grande_illusion
review: One of the best movies of all time. I've never had such a strong urge to watch a movie a second time right after seeing it.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: A terrific masterpiece that should be known and watched by everyone. Its important anti-war message, along with powerful topics such as friendship and humanity, makes this film an essential viewing experience. A masterful classic that will continue to be admired and studied in years to come.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Greatest Foreign Language anti-war movie, aside from being a great movie on its own terms. Admirable restoration!

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Like All Quiet on the Western Front, this film is still one of the best war films ever made.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: One of the few films that rank among the best of any art form. Shocking and brave for it's time, the progressive ideology of the film is more progressive than most films out today.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: An incredible film, with such a brilliant message and such a well thought out manner of portraying it that it deserves its place as one of the greatest films ever made.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Classic perfect film. Old film that is entertaining enough for modern filmgoers to enjoy throughly. For those who may want to watch the film more studiously pay attention to how the film deals with its major themes (race, class, war).

name: la_grande_illusion
review: An arrestingly humanistic, anti-war masterwork, in part thanks to the camera's light and calm motion.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: It's a beautiful film. Not just for the way it looks but what it says & how it moves.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: There's a reason this is always listed among the best film's ever made. It is. The restoration brings Renoir's perfect cinematography to new clarity. Von Stroheim's performance is quietly elegant. You cannot call yourself a film fan until you see this.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: There's a reason this is always listed among the best film's ever made. It is. The restoration brings Renoir's perfect cinematography to new clarity. Von Stroheim's performance is quietly elegant. You cannot call yourself a film fan until you see this.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: simple story with characters both subtle and heartfelt, it's timeless, moving, and easy to love.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: A classic that moves one on many levels. See it if it's playing nearby.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Jean Renoir aims high with this film. Renoir exceeds this and he doesn't miss a beat. After you watch this film, you feel so emotionally drained. Outstanding achievement in telling the story and cinematography. Just as political as it is emotional. My personal 2nd favorite film ever.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Brilliant film. Nuff said

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Admit it: you wish you could be as cool as Jean Gabin.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: The 75th Anniversary restoration is absolutely beautiful. Grand Illusion is a powerful and unforgettable film.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: My first (movie) Criterion that I purchased. How can a guy forget his first?

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Le monde change devant nos yeux. Film absolument superbe!

name: la_grande_illusion
review: [i]Review coming soon.[/i]

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Probably the most fun I've ever had with an anti-war film. Renoir's film is rich in flair, thematic material and humor, and earns every right to be considered one of the most important films of all time. Casa Blanca, took more than a few cues from this.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Perhaps not Renoir's most radical film, but in my opinion his most moving, about the dislocations created by war and the at times futile struggles of men to stay somehow connected--to friends, to social classes, to lost conventions.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Oh sweet Jesus, so much deep focus. Such a good story. Such great directing. Sublime acting. I LOVE IT!

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Sublime, serene, and elegiac. I watch this once a year and that may not be enough. I'm not sure what's more sad: the horrors of war, or trying to place a gentleman's agreement on top of the whole mess. A true 10-star masterpiece.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Great Jean Renoir war film about officers and the death of the nobility in World War 1. Renoir is one of the best directors of all time, and this is one of his best movies.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: ExperiÃªncia cinematografica cinco estrelas. Um filme que quase desapareceu da histÃ³ria do cinema mundial.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: A beautiful, subtle, humane, enormously influential look at war, the people who fight on both sides, and a system of the world that was inexorably on its way out, for better and for worse.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Renoir is easily one of the greatest directors of all time

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Jean Renoirs La Grande Illusion er intet mindre enn ett tidlÃ¸st mesterverk! Jean Gabin, Pierre Fresnay og Erich Von Stroheim spiller hovedrollene i dette episke verket om vennskap og aristokrati. En klassiker!

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Grand Illusion is a timeless peace of cinema forever ensured to be remembered generation by generation. It`s just a remarkable film you have to experience for yourself.

name: la_grande_illusion

name: la_grande_illusion
review: c juste trop grandiose!!!

name: la_grande_illusion
review: A magnificent film which questions the very nature of our social and ethnic divisions. Offers in the grimmest of contexts, when all the divisive prejudices have sunk along with all prior notions of civilization, the possibility for a new model of pacifism, humanism and egalitarianism to emerge.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Very exciting and extremely ingenious

name: la_grande_illusion
review: It's a curious film. The title is purposely misleading. The "illusion" doesn't have to do with escaping from any POW camp.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: A very layered, and thoughtful work. Fantastic use of a disjointed 3-act structure. I think I prefer to The Rules of the Game. 9.5/10

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Never have I seen an Anti-War film so impressionable; one of the deepest, most critical films of its century.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: one of the 10 greatest films I have ever seen...

name: la_grande_illusion
review: A intelligent and subtle way of expressing the fear of war through the people effected by it. Some directors today still feel righteous to show heroism during war, where in fact Renoir's anti war message is considerably more apt.

name: la_grande_illusion

name: la_grande_illusion
review: My favorite Renoir, and starring the great Jean Gabin and Erich von Stroheim

name: la_grande_illusion

name: la_grande_illusion
review: The most unique WWI film I have seen. No attempt to show the trenches, but the relationships of people. I enjoyed, hmm-mmm.

name: la_grande_illusion

name: la_grande_illusion
review: One of the greatest films ever made!

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Nice little "surviving adversity" film with a sorta/kinda happy ending. Oh, wait...what's this subplot about class? Or antisemitism? Or relationships transcending politics/class/language? WTF! Why is all this serious stuff in my entertainment?

name: la_grande_illusion
review: If this isn't the greatest movie ever made, it's certainly in the top 20. There is layer upon layer of subtext and social commentary in this film, on top of a pretty gripping story. It's much more than a POW film, and it's worth seeing at least once in a lifetime.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: A great anti war film. GW would ban it if he could...

name: la_grande_illusion
review: the great classic. everyone should have seen it

name: la_grande_illusion
review: One of the best movies of all time!

name: la_grande_illusion
review: You've heard of this for a reason. It's one of the best films ever made. It's silly to say anything more. But it certainly holds up more than well.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: A very nice, fun film. It deals with everything from war to class to race in a prison camp environment. A classic brilliant film.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Consistently number one or two on my list of greatest films of all time. Pure cinematic poetry. Unforgettable.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: An amazing, deeper-than-expected film by Jean Renoir. It's a complex look at war, and the fracturing and bringing together that it is capable of. Humor is wisely weaved in, and with a superb cast, this film tackles the war with whole-hearted conviction.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: A beautiful film in many ways. Renoir's constantly moving camera provides the film with a wonderful kineticism. I was surprised at how funny the film was, which works in its favor and makes its anti-war message that much more poignant.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: My favorite movie of all time. Probably one of the earlier anti-war films, it takes place, mostly, in a prisoner-of-war camp during WWI, and depicts the class struggle on both sides of the conflict.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Most nuanced war movie I've ever seen. Incredible.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: un chef d'oeuvre : humour a la Audiard avant Audiard et humanité en temps de guerre. magnifique

name: la_grande_illusion
review: If we through Bogart and Gable in this bad boy we have the Beatles of early sound film. This all star cast and amazing director combine powers to create a film that has stood the test of time for over 70 years. Erich von Stroheim is the coolest sad, old man in the history of cinema... maybe.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: The 86% of people 'not interested' in seeing this film should be ashamed.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Something that great films have in common is that they stretch across more than 3 acts. There is a reason why most critics include this film in their 'top 5' list of greatest films.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: One of the greatest war movies ever.

name: la_grande_illusion

name: la_grande_illusion
review: One of the best movies ever made

name: la_grande_illusion

name: la_grande_illusion

name: la_grande_illusion

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Powerful movie... one of the 3 best films I've ever seen (with Citizen Kane and The Godfather Pt. II). Gabin is incredible! I used to have the Criterion Collection DVD of this film; sadly, I sold it a couple of years ago.

review: Hitler called it Cinematic public enemy number one. Amazing stuff, heavily borrowed by Casablanca but a richer film that is the true father of all anti-war movies

name: la_grande_illusion
review: A magnificent film which questions the very nature of our social and ethnic divisions. Offers in the grimmest of contexts, when all the divisive prejudices have sunk along with all prior notions of civilization, the possibility for a new model of pacifism, humanism and egalitarianism to emerge.

name: la_grande_illusion

name: la_grande_illusion

name: la_grande_illusion
review: A war film where only 1 shot is fired. This, Paths Of Glory & The Deer Hunter are the finest films about the absurdity & horror of war --if you ask me.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: A grand masterpiece with a great trio of actors, Jean Gabin, Fresnay and Stroheim. A must see anti-war movie.

name: la_grande_illusion

name: la_grande_illusion

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Le film pacifiste par excellence. Il raconte la fin d'un monde, prophetise les horreurs de la deuxieme guerre mondiale qui s'annoncait a l'epoque, tout en affirmant l'humanite de tous les etres humains, sans exception. Les pseudo-pacificistes de notre epoque devraient en prendre de la graine...

name: la_grande_illusion

name: la_grande_illusion

name: la_grande_illusion
review: A beautiful film in so many ways. Taken at face value, the film is entertaining as is. Delve below into the messages and implications of the story, though, and you'll find a bittersweetly intricate tale of human interaction and conflict and the strife that it so often carries.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: A classic movie that defies easy classification. I would not call it simply "anti-war"; war is mostly distant. Perhaps it is mostly about people in a situation that forces them the make ultimate choices of displaying what they are, or what they would like themselves to be.

name: la_grande_illusion

name: la_grande_illusion

name: la_grande_illusion

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Probably my favorite film by Jean Renoir - and that's saying something! A sophisticated reflection on class and civility during the Great War. Featuring some of the finest acting the camera ever captured, Renoir's Grand Illusion stands deservedly as one of the cinema's all time greats.

name: la_grande_illusion
review: Certainly my favourite film. I prefer it to Rules of the Game. A most beautiful and humane film.

name: la_grande_illusion

name: 1000626-all_about_eve
review: The bitchiest film ever made. An outstanding script with dynamite performances. It's a brutal attack on Hollywood and the fanaticism with celebrities. Timeless and way ahead of its time. It makes a nice companion piece to both A Star is Born (with Garland) and Scorsese's King of Comedy.

name: 1000626-all_about_eve
review: I really, really love this movie, it is the best black-and-white movie ever!!!!! Performances are amazing, Bette Davis, Anne Baxter, George Sanders, Celeste Holm, and Thelma Ritter give such magnificient performances.

name: let_the_right_one_in

name: let_the_right_one_in
review: "Let The Right One In" is like a fairytale in vampire/horror style, it has brilliant story, a love story but never be lack of haunting event. This is the one of the best vampire film and one of highest quality romance film I've ever seen, and it made "Twilight" seems like a piece of trash.

name: let_the_right_one_in
review: one of the best movies ive seen!! its so different and unlike anything else, the performances are great and the fact that there is so much to discover in the details just shows how good of a film this is. absolutely loved it!

review: Raw. Real. Emotional. Thrilling.

name: let_the_right_one_in
review: OH MY GOD! I am in LOVE!This is poetry, horror, love, loneliness, LIFE, all in one!The photography, the soundtrack, the performances, simply amazing! One of the most beautiful films i've seen in a long time!

name: let_the_right_one_in
review: Probably the best vampire movie I've ever seen, and in general, near the top of the best movies I've ever seen. Very thrilling.

name: let_the_right_one_in
review: This is everything that Twilight could have been! Hey, OHY!! Stephanie Meyer! Look at this, and study it for God's sake! This is how the romance of vampires and humans are supposed to be played out! You should be ashamed of yourself woman!

name: let_the_right_one_in
review: I'm not a fan of vampires, or movies about kids. But oh, is this so much more than that. Filled with symbolism and metaphors, Let The Right One In is an artsy and beautiful atmospheric film, that treats its violence and brutality with respect.

name: let_the_right_one_in
review: Combines a 'slice-of-life' style of cinematography with some really horrific imagery and surprisingly complex characters, including the vampire of the film. This is urban fantasy/horror done perfectly.

name: 1013775-metropolis
review: The work on remaking this movie while keeping the intent of the original piece was done very well. The inserted script panels to help explain the story were meant to lend a more coherent plot to the story. I liked it very much and it remains one of my favorite movies of all time.

name: 1013775-metropolis
review: For a good reason, I have never seen any other edits of Metropolis except for (luckily) the new restoration. However, I don't feel that even words can describe how awesome it is. The point is, only see the 2010 restoration, and if you can, see it on the big screen. I know I did.

name: 1013775-metropolis
review: The recently restored version is a winner, so many of the restored scenes helped you bond with the characters, they're no longer mysteries, they have motivation.

name: 1013775-metropolis
review: A real and true classic. The acting style is old-fashioned, the politics kind of simplistic, but it's all good thanks to Lang's great sense of style and dizzying set pieces. Oh, and the 210-minute cut was recently found!

name: 1013775-metropolis
review: It is single handedly THE most awe-inspiring silent motion picture I have ever seen. You have to get the restored authorized version that is close to Fritz Lang's version. Tragically, some of the footage was destroyed, but they fill in the empty spaces for you.

name: the_battle_of_algiers

name: the_battle_of_algiers
review: What a powerful statement of a movie. This movie basically acts as a blueprint to how a community of people can regain their freedom and independence in their country.The whole plot and documentary-like cinematography are definitely something to get inspired by. Awesome movie!

name: the_battle_of_algiers
review: I was suprised by how well this movie is made considering it was filimed in 1966.

name: the_battle_of_algiers
review: A must see film, powerfully depicts the events that transpired in Algiers in 1954-1957. The gritty black and white cinematography greatly adds to the documentary style ambience.

name: the_battle_of_algiers
review: Awesome film. You can keep a people down for a while but never forever. One day, tomorrow or in a hundred years, but one day for certain they will over throw you and, rightfully, regain their freedom.

name: the_battle_of_algiers
review: i can't imagine a future where this movie isn't a masterpiece

name: the_battle_of_algiers
review: Perhaps the most vivid depiction of a revolt against colonial rule ever captured on film, "The Battle of Algiers," documents all too realistically the futility of solving conflicts with violence.

name: the_battle_of_algiers
review: Quite possibly the most realistic depiction of war in cinematic history, with an unparalleled attention to detail and high production value. The insights it provides into insurgency and terrorism also add to its importance as a film.

name: the_battle_of_algiers
review: The tragic violent clash of imperialism masquerading as civilization and narcissism masquerading as nationalism makes for a. astoundingly powerful impressionistic account of the Algerian revolution. Classic.

name: the_battle_of_algiers
review: The Black Panthers and the IRA used this film as a training manual, which diminishes it's very unique power a little, but if you can put that out of your mind it is a stunning piece of filmmaking. Once you see it you'll never forget it.

name: the_battle_of_algiers
review: The struggle for independence and a freedom is never easy. The Battle of Algiers portrays the hardships of the Algerian nation against a suppressing French presence with extraordinary detail to emotion, the political prowess, and ideology.

name: the_battle_of_algiers
review: A film about the struggle of a united people. while the French may have won the battle, the Algerians would win the war. This is a telling story of how united people cannot be stopped.

name: the_battle_of_algiers
review: With its issues of torture and cultural conflict ("It's not torture, it's interrogation"), it's never been more relevant.

name: the_battle_of_algiers
review: A film from the perspective of terrorists. The anger, tension, and suspense curl up on your lap and force you to watch it from start to finish.

name: the_battle_of_algiers

name: the_battle_of_algiers
review: Superb. An extraordinary achievement. It is sometimes difficult to believe that it is a film, and not some fly-on-the-wall documentary. What struck me about it, among other things, is how relevent it continues to be. Highly recommended.

name: the_battle_of_algiers
review: Simply put, I feel this is the best movie I've ever seen, behind 12 Angry Men and There Will Be Blood and this is possibly the best war movie I have ever seen.

Shows the utter brutalities commited on each side, FLN are portrayed as well organised urban guerillas, who carry on the fight even when all looks hopeless. Dont miss the Ennio Morricone score either

name: the_battle_of_algiers

name: anatomy-of-a-murder
review: Next to the great noir "Laura", this is Otto's finest hour. With a superb cast and a great knack for "court-rooms", this drama takes us to uncharted film dimensions in 1959. A must see for people with an interest in a trial motion picture, or just an avid film fan.

name: anatomy-of-a-murder

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: 1955 . Featuring Robert Mitchum's formidable performance as a child-hunting preacher, The Night of the Hunter is a disturbing look at good and evil.

review: Great movie. It's like a fairy tale about good and evil wrapped up in the horror and noir shell, with a chilling Robert Mitchum's performance as a serial killer/false prophet.

name: night_of_the_hunter

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: At the time of its release, this was for sure a very frightening experience. Nowadays, it is still a haunting classic as I remembered it to be upon watching it for the first time.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Hauntingly beautiful cinematography, a fabulous score, and an indelible performance by Robert Mitchum who plays one of the most chilling villains in cinema. Despite a nauseating, sugary ending, Night of the Hunter is deservedly a classic.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Unfortunately this movie was too dated and slow-paced for me to be engaged or in any kind of suspense. The lecture from the old lady at the end was the last straw for me. I can't believe I'm actually saying this, but perhaps it could be remade, Lord help us all.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: One of the finest pieces of American cinema ever made. If you haven't seen it, move it to the top of your list.

name: night_of_the_hunter

name: night_of_the_hunter

name: night_of_the_hunter

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: I must have watched this movie at least a dozen times. It is wholly unique - its tone blackly comic, the storyline a hybrid of Grimm's fairytale and pursuit thriller. It is our loss that Laughton never directed another movie: with just this one work he proved he was one of the greats.

name: night_of_the_hunter

review: A stunning film that might as well be the most pleasant nightmare I've ever had.

review: Astounding on so many different levels I cannot begin to comprehend how an audience or critic could be immune to its haunting beauty!

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: One of the scariest movies I've ever seen, and Harry Powell might have wormed his way towards the top of my favorite villains list. Wow.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Robert Mitchum's intimidating performance as a murderous preacher epitomizes the film's unsettling portrait of evil.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Greatest film ever made. Truly a tragedy that Laughton never directed another film due to the mixed response for this one. Utter idiots.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Creepy, thrilling, and amazing. Robert Mitchum is an excellent actor, and quite frightening.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: I thought this film was poor and over hyped

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: dreams combining with nightmares..noir,gothic,fairytale,biblical all rolled into an unforgettable joyride...

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: A beautifully made thriller from the 50's that still weaves an eerie web over its audience to this day. One of my favourite films!!

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: awesome movie. need to buy it

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: one of the greatest suspense movies of all time

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: To me this is a brilliant haunting mystery/drama. Robert Mitchum turns in one of my favorite performances.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: We all know that Robert Mitchum plays a great character, whether it's on or off screen.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: The Night of the Hunter is a scary thriller, featuring a disturbing yet effective performance from Robert Mitchum as a preacher turned child-hunter. It's also thought-provoking at it's look at love ( good ) and hate ( evil ).

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Awesome old school movie!!!! A must watch.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Excellent movie. This movie is just creepy, especially with Robert Mitchum. If you like classics, give it a try!

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: The greatest horror film to not be categorized as horror, Night of the Hunter is as gasp-inducing and as heart-throbbing as you can get--even from today's standards.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: With possibly the best lighting I've ever seen, a fantastic lead performance, haunting vocals, spectacular dialogue, and iconic imagery, this is one of the best movies I've seen in years. Maybe ever.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: I can't remember the last time I've seen a nailbiting film like Night of the Hunter. All I can say is that this is a thriller that rivals any of Alfred Hitchcock's masterpieces, for the acting, story, cinematography and memorable dialogue are absolutely outstanding.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Robert Mitchum becomes a living nightmare in this amazing Southern film-noir/horror picture. The black and white cinematography is impeccable. A terrifying masterpiece.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Superb at every level.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: This is one twisted flick. Mitchum sizzles as one of the most evil characters ever put on-screen.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: An under seen gem. A kids movie that is frightening. A magical fairy tale without any fantasy elements.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: one of mitchums finest roles along with his performance in cape fear, unnerving and haunting.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: An unsung masterpiece in its day, Night of the Hunter has some of the finist crafted tension ever seen in film, alongside one of the most terrifying villians in Mitchum's Powell.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: The Night of the Hunter has a magnificent atmosphere and Robert Mitchum's performance is spine-chilling.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Robert Mitchum delivers in this classic thriller, knuckle tattoos & all.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: I can't believe it took me this long to see this masterpiece. Unforgettable imagery. Simultaneously guileless and utterly cynical, it whistles hymns in the dark.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Has there ever been a more chilling villain in movie history? Such a shame that Laughton was put off ever directing again

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: This is a masterpiece. The performance by Robert Mitchum as Preacher Harry Powell is one of the most haunting I have ever seen. If you are a fan of cinema, you should be required to see this fantastic movie.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Aside from Robert Mitchum's unsettling depiction of a psychopath, this movie is a beautiful, eerie noir parable that seems to thrive the more maudlin and exaggerated it gets.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Night of the Hunter is, like the hands of 'Reverend' Powell, a very chilling and wonderful work. Robert Mitchum is electrifying.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: A chilling nightmare. Any film that has me literally clutching a pillow with white knuckles has accomplished something. Robert Mitchum is a terrifying villain who paints a religious allegory that may be more applicable to today's society than it was to that of the mid-50's.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Charles Laughton's only film directing effort,so sad, we were robbed.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: The darkest cinematic fairy tale.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Unique mise-en-scne with German expressionism mixed in. Robert Mitchum is actually quite haunting in this film, and theres several scenes that just chill you to the bone, such as the scene where the viewer sees Shelly Winters in the lake. A great film for discussion.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Oh contemporary film makers, if only you knew how to make a chilling nightmare of darkness, religion, social critique and endurance with light, shadow, some houses, a river and some animals. Utterly captivating.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: I was blown away by Robert Mitchum's performance in this brilliant film.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: the most remarkable thing i've ever seen. rich with meaning, left me gasping for air at the end.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Great. Great great great. Robert Mitchum is one of the most convincing villains in cinematic history here.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Fantastic, classic, extremely creepy thriller. Beautifully shot in a near expressionist style. Great cast headed by Mitchum who oozes smarm and evil. Truely great stuff.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Night of the Hunter is a thrilling masterpiece and a great study of good and evil. When first released it was not loved by critics, but this film proves that it sometimes takes a long time for people to realize the greatness in a film.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: terrible. I find this movie amazingly silly, not in a good way.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: A horror masterpiece that still looks fresh even today. Mitchum's menacing performance is one that will stick in your mind. It's a shame Charles Laughton only directed one film.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: A ghoulishly beautiful fairy tale

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: The quintessential noir.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Terrible. Everything about this film is campy, and not in the good way. I don't think the campiness of the film was intentional at all- and the effect makes your stomach turn.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Charles Laughton's only effort is a masterpiece.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Still brilliant and still should absolutely be seen. Mitchum is electric.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: One of the most terrifying characters ever created dominates innocent children.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: CLASSIC THRILLER NOIR

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Masterwork of expressionism, amazing to look at and the only horror film that's images have actually stuck with me

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: One of the most frightening movies I have ever seen.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Disturbing and creepy shot with beautiful german cinematography. The Night of the Hunter is in a category all its own.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Simply terrible film. Can't imagine why someone would consider it a "classic" let alone "film-noir". The script is just insultingly blunt and so are the performances (yes, Mitchum's as well). Definitely one of the worst films I've seen.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Everytime someone sees Mitchum's performance in this, the angels weep. But it's a good thing!

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Thanks to its excellently creepy imagery it's like watching someone's beautiful yet frightening nightmare. Robert Mitchum's a terrifying villain stalking and hunting a young pair of siblings until he meets Lillian Gish's wonderful character in a false prophet vs. true prophet showdown.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: This is really an example of great, brilliant movie making. Great acting all around, beautiful imagery, and one of the most chilling movies ever made.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: One of the most amazing and truly chilling film noirs I've ever seen. Robert Mitchum is truly terrifying in the role of a demented and manipulative preacher, even by modern movie standards!

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Visually expressive, deeply allegorical, and scary as hell. One of the best films ever made.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: The Night of the Hunter raises important questions about the darker side of religious faith and the chilling ways in which people condone their actions through their belief. Expressing as much through its effulgent lighting as through its haunting themes, it is a film of incredible visual appeal.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: A masterpiece and one of the most beautiful black-and-white movies I have ever seen. If Terrence Malick wasn't at least slightly influenced by this movie, I'll eat my shoe.**not to be taken seriously.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Edge of your seat suspense. Rachel Cooper is a bad-ass.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: A down stream, fairytale nightmare. Genuinely creepy.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Fantastic movie. I am saddened by the little number of people who have seen this movie. Mitchum is great as the preacher. Make this the next movie you see.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: It's a shame that Robert Mitchum didn't receive an Academy Award nomination from this timeless masterpiece.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: A classic. One of the finest American films ever made.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Children do what adults have spent years perfecting--and better.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Definitely one of the most atmospheric horror films of all time. incredible performance by Mitchum

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Someday, Lillian Gish will save us all.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Every shots, Every scenes, Must have a moment

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: eres vanguardista y crees que las de antes estan sobrevaloradas?...mirate esta joya!!!....antes de Hannibal Lecter y el joker estaba Harry Powell...LOVE - HATE...simplemente magistral!!!

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: This was a tour de' force start to finish in every aspect of the film. Watch it, watch it now.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: A truly unique movie boasting an iconic performance by Robert Mitchum!

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Up there with Texas Chain Saw Massacre as one of the greatest American movies of all time.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Often mistaken for a film noir ... more like a fairy tale.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: THIS MOVIE IS ONE OF THE BEST OF ALL TIME

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Great thriller of a story, great directing (only attempt, really?), great cinematography. Robert Mitchum is creeeeeeepy! Shelley WInters is her classic whiney self. God I love this movie and have seen it over and over again. Watched it On Demand this afternoon during the rain.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Stupendous psycho-thriller supported by memorable Robert Mitchum.Indispensable

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Words fail. Stay away from Robert Mitchum.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: It's not always believable, but Mitchum's chilling performance truly draws you in. As the terror slowly mounts, any slight hiccups are entirely forgivable.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Watch this movie to see the fight between love and hate.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: I both fear and revere Robert Mitchum.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: A truly unique film, the only one ever directed by Laughton. A wonderful thriller that still manages to shock even 56 years later.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Robert Mitchum is some twisted psychopath in this film.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Mitchum is brilliant. Tense excellent. The director is brilliant

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: One of the simplest and most sinister films of all time. Probably one of the best, if not thee best, film ever made in America.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Couldn't love this more if I tried. It's perfect. Everytime I see it I find something new to love about it. Go watch it if you haven't yet.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Boah!!! This is the Perfection of Film Noir!!! Defently one of my Favourite Movies!!! Dark, Disturbing, Bewichting, Grotueske & Funny!!! Breathtaking Cinematography, Robert Mitchum's Part is the Perfection of the Psycho!!! And It contains Lilian Gish!!! The Soundtrack is Bombastic!!!

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: A masterpiece of cinema that showcases the desires of man and evil that exists in the most unlikely of places. I think the left hand of Mitchum's preacher prevailed in the end, leading to his downfall.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Unlike anything else you will ever see. Beautiful, lyrical- and terrifying.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Perfect in every way, and the only horror film that can make me cry.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: My favorite horror movie of all time. I just wish I could find a DVD of it so I could show it to my friends.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Creepy as hell. Superb.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Brilliant, beautiful, unique American Gothic.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Robert Micthum is absolutley brilliant and scary in this. The story was great and Billy Chapin was perfectly cast. However, the last thirty minutes, the film slows and down and loses some of the edge and suspence that made the first hour so memorable. Aside from that, this was a great, great film.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: I can't believe it took me this long to see this masterpiece. Unforgettable imagery. Simultaneously guileless and utterly cynical, it whistles hymns in the dark.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: One of the best thrillers ever made. Mitchum was excellent and very convincing as a creepy "Preacher"  The intense musical stings in the film remind me so much of "Cape Fear" another great one to watch.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Classic, Robert Mitcum's ultimate bad ass role, even more so than Max Cady.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Some pretty arresting imagery and a religious lunatic as sinister villain. Recipe for success as far as I'm concerned, 'specially in 1955. 5/5 from me. 98% on RT.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: This is an exhilarating little story. "A Mother Goose Nightmare" is how it is described on the booklet in the DVD package. I couldn't think of a better way to sum up this gem. One of my favorite films.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Beautiful and sublime. One of greatest of all American films.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Mitchum is creepy as hell as the film's villain Rev. Harry Powell.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: I wasn't particularly keen on the cathartic ending-- I was hoping it would be as haunting as the rest of the film. Otherwise, Robert Mitchum is perfectly chilling and the direction is quite novel. This is the best sort of disturbing.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Brilliant film robert mitchem is amazing and genuinly terrifying a great performance.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Fantastic and unforgettable movie. Mitchum is more than superb as a perfectly evil wolf in sheep's clothing. Laughton's direction is perfectly toned - creating a world of fear, love, and greed that is both completely unreal and totally engrossing. I really, really liked this movie.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Awesome movie. Robert Michum gives a great performance and some of the scenes in this movie are just haunting.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: A great film from a great book. A fairytale shot through with the sheer terror of realising you are a child alone in the adult world. Genius

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Robert Mitchum at his best a great movie and great tight story

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: This deserves to be far more well known outside of film-geek circles. I'd say it's comfortably better than a great many American movies of the same period (You got that, AFI?)

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Creepy--in a good way.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: One cannot approach this film with the usual expectations. But no matter the opinion of a viewer upon the plot - it must admitted Robert Mitchum's portrayal of a fanatic preacher-psychokiller is excessive and frightening - and to a delightful degree.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Gothic tale with the most memorable villain, the most memorable visual, the most engagin script. A truly American fairy-noir head of its time, without it perhaps neither Spielberg, nor Tim Burton, nor Cohen Brothers... nor a great part of modern cinema would have come to be. Pure L-O-V-E.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: It's a classic, and honestly a masterpiece !! I'm usually not a big fan of old movies, but this one, really great, so dark. A lot of suspense, and credible. One movie everyone should have seen !!

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: A powerful, and atmospheric thriller noir that was ahead of its time.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: A wonderful haunting folktale of a film. Charles Laughton must have thought best to quit whilst he was ahead.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: This movie scared the crap out of me. Eye candy for sure...

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Excellent! Drama, Mystery, I loved the 'song' stand off. Robert Mitchum was a beast! Shelly Winters young and beautiful - the boy who played John, great! I highly recommend!

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: I had forgotten how crazy Mitchum's character is. He does these disturbing animal noises when he really doesn't get his way. No one in the current crop of serial killer movies has bested him.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Charles Laughton's only effort is a masterpiece.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Great example on how to start a movie with enough information and enough mystery to get the viewer hooked right away.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: The rural noir story is highly compelling in itself, and the visuals and themes elevate the film to an even better level. Robert Mitchum's performance makes for one of the best movie villains I've ever seen.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Charles Laughton... Charles Laughton... Charles laughton!

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: A classic doesn't need any other commentary!!

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: One of the best movies ever made...

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: The quintessential noir.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: This is apparently an inspiration for the Coen Brothers which doesn't surprise me at all. Good noir

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: This is Robert Mitchum's best ever. Brilliant film, really dark.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Visual poetry almost comparable to that of Murnau thirty years prior to 1955!! Excellent!

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: The speech where Robert Mitchum explains the LOVE and HATE tattoos on his knuckles is spell-binding. Very well made movie all around. Has a definite look to it as well as a definite southern flair. If you enjoy film noir you are likely to love this movie.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: I love Robert Mitchum. This film scared the hell out of me when i was young!

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Robert Mitchum is supposed to be scary, but he's a cartoon. Also, the kids overact in typical '50s fashion. This is NO classic, and doesn't belong on any AFI lists.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Excellent movie. I just saw it today. I love its dreamy feel.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Great. Great great great. Robert Mitchum is one of the most convincing villains in cinematic history here.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: I remember seeing this when I was twelve. The riverboat scene blew my mind wide open and I've never been the same.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Beautiful, creepy, and above all haunting; this is a film that will stick with you long after your first viewing.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: An undoubted masterpiece. The performances throughout are superb, the cinematography is incredible. The whole film comes off as slightly surreal and has a slight fairy tale element to it. I could go on and find praise for hours but that doesn't do it justice.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: *****5 Stars......scary movie.....watch it in the dark....  This is a must see....check it out at rotten tomatoes or IMDB if you don't believe me......

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Mind blowing, one-of-kind film uses the movie image better than almost any other American film. Mitchum is mesmerizing as Rev. Powel-Laughton's only film is as well direct as any of any era. Has to be seen by anyone who claims to love movies.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: When love and hate battle you get Lillian Gish on your tail totin' a rifle. Probably my favorite movie of all time.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Mesmerising movie. The only movie that Charles Laughton (Quasimodo in the 1939 BIG-screen adaptation of The Hunchback of Notre Dame) directed.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Fantastic, highly atmospheric southern gothic about innocense and evil. Music and visuals combine to make unforgettable, dreamlike film.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Legendary film about a sociopath preacher serial-killer terrorizing children.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: One of the best film-noir and Robert Mitchum at his best.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: My boyfriend's favorite film. It really is brilliant. Very twisted but very fantastic.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Robert Mitchum is oh so creepy.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Para aquellos que tuvieron la suerte de no verla, no se hagan ilusiones con este film de segunda mano.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: I can't give this film all of the accolades it deserves. Wonderful. Charles Laughton's only directed film. Just amazing.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: superior acting, cannot improve upon (especially John) it's like he really experienced it!

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Is an old movie but worth watching. Was a little weird to see Robert Mitchum in such a character, he was soooo convincing though. lol

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Mitchum is absolutely stupendous in this. Why didn't Charles Laughton direct more? He clearly had a pretty amazing idea of what was what!

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: wonderful.. one of the best usa movies of all time..

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: this is probably one of my favorite performances by robert mitchum. amazing cinematography, use of live animals, singing/hymns, scripture, and lighting. totally awesome and creepy.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: My hero Charles Laughton directed this absolute masterpiece, very dark but a joy to look a, a film that stays with you long after the end credits have finished (drink in the 'dream sequence')x

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Wonderful film that floats effortlessly from horrific to fantastical, and with superb photography to boot.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Robert Mitchum's finest achievement...surreal, strange and very scary indeed...and he even sings too. Sadly Laughton's only directorial attempt as the film was panned critically at the time. Must see.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: An enduring masterpiece-dark, deep, beautiful,aglow.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Watch it. Mitchum is amazing in this.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: El mas terrorífico cuento de hadas todo un clásico

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Le plus incroyable de tous les films, le plus fou et le plus beau ! avec en plus le plus grand acteur de tout l'Ã©tang Robert M.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: straight up classic with the clearest fishing-pond in all of cinema lol

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Need to go back and watch this one again.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: A disturbing and strangely beautiful mix of "Hansel & Gretel" and "Bluebeard", this is more like a European expressionist film than a Hollywood genre piece. Wonderful music and cinematography and Robert Mitchum is unforgettable as the demonic preacher with a hidden agenda.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Robert Mitchum at his scariest. It's shame that this was Charles Laughton's only directorial effort. This is a great thriller.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Terrifying! I'm amazed that this one hasn't been remade by now.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: This movie ROCKS! I loved it! Although Robert Mitchem was great as the evil fake man of the cloth, it was Lillian Gish who stole the show for me. I loved the atmosphere and all the woodland creatures along the river. What a nice ending too. You must see this old classic.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Dark masterpiece from Charles Laughton. A fop on its release, this was the only film he got to direct, how criminal is that?

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Incontournable, un cinéma d'un autre temps. Un conte cruel et inoubliable.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: A great film if you want to be a little creeped out. Crazy phsycho religous

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Perfection! Total Beauty! A Treasure! I'm speechless!

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: I love this film so much I could cry - and now you can watch it on Hulu for free anytime.l

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: An underrated American masterpiece that can't be conveniently placed in any one category. It contains elements of horror, fantasy, comedy and expressionism that blend together into a truly unique cinematic experience. Robert Mitchum's performance is one for the ages as well.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Great suspense film with maybe the best use of children in danger in cinema, and perhaps Robert Mitchum's best performance. Too bad Charles Laughton didn't direct more movies.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: A masterpiece. The thriller/horror directors of today could learn a thing or two from this film. Laughton's direction is stunning -- I wish he made more films -- and Mitchum is a force of nature. See it now.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Excellent. The cinematography and lighting are some of the best of all time. If that's not enough, Robert Mitchum gives the best performance of his career. Dammit Charles Laughton, why was the ONLY film you ever directed???

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: This is still bizarre and creepy 50 years later. No other movie is remotely similar to this.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Holy crap, is this movie good! Full review coming soon...

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: You won't even believe that this film exists! Wait till you see devil Robert Mitchem & old lady Lillian Gish duel while singing the sweetest gospel duet ever. And the most disturbing wedding night ever.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Two movies in one, 5 stars each, is it a 10 star movie?

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: The only film Sir Charles Laughton ever directed. Amazing and disturbing, this film boasts the first helicopter shot ever filmed for a movie. A must see, Shelly Winters at her best. Read the book if you get the chance!

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: incredibly dark and frightening.truly one of the greatest thrillers ever filmed.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: This movie is best watched, late a night with all the lights out. Doesn't seem at all dated even after 50 years. Mitchum is far more scarier then anything Jason or Freddy could ever dream up.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Mitchum plays his characher so well its chilling. The scene in the basement when he is looking for the kids is really good.

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: Robert mitchum in his best role. Fantastic film and superb soundtrack.Hate and Love!!!

name: night_of_the_hunter
review: one of the greatest movies of all time. robert mitchum as the corrupt preacher will give you chills. i think it was ahead of its time, too, with the creepy camera angles.

name: night_of_the_hunter

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: This is an awesome film! It's a fascinating take on behind the scenes ballet, and includes one of the greatest dance scenes ever put to film. Powell and Pressburger achieved something that could not be done with cinema or ballet alone!

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: WOW. If you haven't seen this movie, definitely see it, especially if you love dance.

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: One of the most perfect movies ever

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: Impeccably mounted and featuring some of the most stunningly gorgeous visuals ever put to film, "The Red Shoes" is the quintessential film about the need for artistic perfection, and rightfully so; it's practically perfect itself.

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: Flawless and beautiful.

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: A stunning example of Technicolor cinematography courtesy of Jack Cardiff enhances this beautifully told tale of a ballerina torn between her passion for dance and her marriage.

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: The best ballet film ever.

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: A ballet picture so sensuous in its art and expressive in its narrative, it should be absorbed rather than observed.

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: Often cited as Martin Scorsese's favourite film, the movie has the most exciting sequence in cinema history. Worth watching.

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: There is no film I adore more than The Red Shoes.

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: Rarely do I rate films 5/5. The Red Shoes is an exception to this.

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: Pure brilliance. It is perfect all the way through. The Red Shoes scene is something like the Avant-Garde films from the twenties its technical achievement in imagination is first rate, definitely has become one of my favourite films.

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: The most beautiful movie I've ever seen.

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: Gracieux et fantastique , les chaussons rouges est le plus beau film de danse à ce jour .

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: Powell and Pressburger's gorgeous and well acted backstage drama is one of cinema's most beautiful technicolor creations, a gloriously sensual and passionate ode to the artist and the transformative power of art.

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: Anybody who ever tried to have a normal life while trying to be an artist will relate. Can you do it? Is it possible? Even if you're not an artist, you will identify with the lead's dilemma: can you have it all? Beautiful and very well edited and the dance scenes were wonderfully choreographed.

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: PALAVRAS NÃO VÃO DESCREVER.

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: Holy God the look of this film is marvelously unparalleled. The Criterion Restoration is simply breathtaking. Also, Anton Walbrook's performance is incredible in its subtleties and its ocular power.

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: One of my favorites of all time.

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: Astonishing. The greatest film about art in any form. The dance sequence is beyond cinema. Technicolor and Shearer were made for each other. My jaw was dropped for the entire 2 hours and 16 minutes. A++++

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: There used to be a time when movies were not only about special effects. When acting, dancing and directing were things that made movies. A great film.Oh yes, and the colours... just superb!!!

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: Words alone can not describe how wonderful this film is

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: Technicolor was invented for this movie.

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: The Criterion blu-ray is amazing quality.

name: 1017346-red_shoes

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: The Red Shoes is a dark fantasy with an inspirational aesthetic - a film that makes you want the dancing to never end.

name: 1017346-red_shoes

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: A bravura of spectacular photography and exceptional score. One of the best dance film that everybody should see.

name: 1017346-red_shoes

name: 1017346-red_shoes

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: ?'The Red Shoes' stands along side 'A Matter of Life and Death', 'Black Narcissus' and 'Peeping Tom' as one of Powell and Pressburger's greatest accomplishments of British cinema.

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: 'The Red Shoes' stands along side 'A Matter of Life and Death', 'Black Narcissus' and 'Peeping Tom' as one of Powell and Pressburger's greatest accomplishments of British cinema.

name: 1017346-red_shoes

name: 1017346-red_shoes

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: Cinema at it's best. Simply spellbinding!

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: A beautifully shot film (three-strip technicolor) that reminds us of how much movies can manipulate the mind. Beware, as you debate the concepts of passion and love you'll lose yourself in the spell this masterpiece casts upon you.

name: 1017346-red_shoes

name: 1017346-red_shoes

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: The cruel dance of life in The Red Shoes is at the same time magnificent, disturbing, refined and, without a doubt, ironically seductive with the furious performance of Anton Walbrook as Boris Lermontov. In short (and personally), a drama that borders on perfection.

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: Absolutely loved this classic ballet drama. Wow!

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: If there was one word to describe it, that word would be gorgeous.

name: 1017346-red_shoes

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: For me, this is the pinnacle of the Powell and Pressburger collaboration films. It's fantastically beautiful and features great performances from the entire cast. The criterion release is just gorgeous on blu-ray.

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: Sumptuous...its influence is so apparent on so many other films (MOULIN ROUGE and BLACK SWAN to name two offhand). I miss the good ol' days of sets constructed on sound stages. Screw realism and budgets -- build me a beautiful set that transports me to some other place any day!

name: 1017346-red_shoes

name: 1017346-red_shoes
review: Simply a masterpiece, and a somewhat neglected one at that. The ballet sequence is sensational, the casting is perfection. The visual beauty of the film is even easier to appreciate in the newly restored edition.

name: roman_holiday
review: "Roman Holiday" is remarkable just because Audrey Hepburn isn't gratingly over-the-top as she is in most movies. "Roman Holiday" is well-scripted and well-acted with gorgeous visuals shot on location in Italy. It's a charming film with wit fresh enough for a modern audience.

name: army_of_shadows
review: This is not a film, this is a remorseless testimony. 'army of shadows' will mark you like (very) few films. Never did I see such a cold-blooded way to shoot a film, and never did I see such unbearable tension. No one but Kessel could have written it, and no one but Melville have directed it I guess.

name: army_of_shadows
review: Melville captured me with his long study of characters. These characters are freedom fighters in the resistance during WWII. The audience cannot help but be impressed by the conviction in these fighters. I want to see it again.

name: army_of_shadows
review: ARMY OF SHADOWS is one of the greatest war films I've ever seen. It is a melancholy, deep and honest depiction of desperate people in a dark period of history. Riveting all the way through, this is an indisputable masterpiece from the great French filmmaker Jean-Pierre Melville.

name: army_of_shadows
review: As of today, Army of Shadows is the greatest film I've ever seen. Never have I been as paralyzed as I was by a film's greatness. Genius flows in every frame.

name: army_of_shadows
review: One of the great films about the French resistance, Army of Shadows was not well thought of when it was first released in 1969, but is now thought of as one of Melville's greatest films. Riveting.

name: army_of_shadows
review: One of the best movies I've seen in a long time.

name: army_of_shadows
review: An engrossing, brutally frank story of bleak isolation and paranoid dread. A heartbreaking masterpiece.

name: army_of_shadows
review: A work of precision, Army of Shadows while ill paced, is a profoundly philosophical investigation of humanity, morality and bravery.

name: army_of_shadows
review: as good as it gets as a portrait of courage and an anti-faschist polemic

name: army_of_shadows
review: my favorite french film

name: army_of_shadows
review: Army of Shadows is a dark, harrowing & brutal depiction of the French Resistance with unforgettable scenes of heroism & danger.

name: army_of_shadows
review: Beautifully shot, gloriously atmospheric, and meticulously gripping. A rich film about the underground French Resistance during WWII. I'd rank it up with "Battle for Algiers," "Z," and "The Manchurian Candidate" for great political thrillers.

name: army_of_shadows
review: All I can say is wow.

name: army_of_shadows
review: One of the best war films you're likely to find.

name: army_of_shadows
review: A film to be watched like wine is to be drank. Saviour this for all its subtleties, nuances and textures... it is so rich. Go slow and have patience.

name: army_of_shadows
review: Best film about any Resistance movement I have seen in a long time.

name: army_of_shadows
review: The best movie I've ever seen. No other movie has ever made me feel the amount of tension that Army of Shadows has. As close as anyone could ever get to being a member of the French Resistance.

name: army_of_shadows
review: Encore un classique !

name: army_of_shadows
review: Supremely realistic film that gets under your skin and stays with you long after the credits have rolled. One of the masterpieces of French Cinema and one of the best films I've ever seen. 9.5/10

name: army_of_shadows
review: Melville is known more for his "Le Doulos" and "Le Samourai" but this brilliant film focussing on the French resistance is a rare piece of Cinematic genius.Multi layered,suspenseful,realistic and ultimately cynical,this is a keeper.

name: army_of_shadows
review: For some strange reason this film was either banned or never shown in the US until recently. A powerful yet bleak view of so called heroism during WWII. You could even leave the cinema with a doubt about who are in the right in any war when it comes to torture, abuse and murder. Gripping stuff.

name: army_of_shadows
review: Wonderfully complex take on the French resistance. All drama is quiet, and while there is suspense, a good bit of it is generated by moral dilemmas and the lengths to which "heroes" must go during wartime.

name: army_of_shadows
review: The price of espionage troops.Ventura,Signoret,Meurisse,the all-star cast of Melville was ready to drum the front-line of A-class film-making,of which the remains of it some decades later are distant echoes,entangled subplots,why...I'll admit only Hitler was missing!

name: army_of_shadows
review: Not so much a war movie as a movie about ordinary people doing what they can do, even if it appears futile. The performances are all outstanding and the colour of this movie (or at least the exemplary Criterion Collection edition) is so beautiful it remains with you for days.

name: the_conformist
review: The Conformist is one of the most beautiful visions of life ever recorded on film, displaying Italy's architecture as monuments surrounded by tableau.

name: the_conformist
review: The ending. The very last scene in the movie. That look he gives without saying anything at all says everything about his character outline throughout the entire movie. I'm blown away.

name: the_conformist
review: The Conformist is commendable for its lavish production and masterful photography, certainly, but where the brilliance lies is in its portrayal of a man who is in a constant struggle with not only his political affiliations, but with his marriage, his sexuality, and his life.

name: the_conformist
review: Exquisite, poignant, and extremely alluring.

name: the_conformist
review: Another take on the banality of evil, through the cowardice and desire for conformity even though he is aware things outside of such conformity. An entirely visual rumination on life, but difficult if to follow narratively.

name: the_conformist
review: The title says it all.

name: the_conformist
review: A must see film. Bertolucci is completely at ease and this is where it all starts.

name: the_conformist
review: 'Animula vagula blandula Hospes comesque corporis' (Little soul of mine, tender and soft, sweet companion of my body). Capturing Rene Magritte's surreal paintings, this film about identity portrays an unforgettable cinematic and dynamic style of beauty.

name: the_conformist
review: One of my favourite films - a perfect cast, great cinematography, fantastic use of colour and space. Hard to beat.

name: the_conformist
review: Far less deep than it appears to be, The Conformist is sustained by the beauty of its compositions and the elegance of its camerawork, which capture the false grandeur of fascist Italy and one man's attempt to evade its evil in order to live a "normal" life.

name: the_conformist
review: Dialogues, performances, cinematography, soundtrack: everything works perfectly and creates a tense atmosphere that helps the film to become one of Bertolucci's great masterpieces.

name: the_conformist
review: the best photographed film I have ever seen.

name: the_conformist
review: The Conformist is clever and intelligent, sporadic and entertaining, featuring a wide array of visuals that spark artsy inspiration and a fascist centerpiece that ignites political commentary.

name: the_conformist
review: Brilliant cinematography,clever shot-taking n a delightful conception....one of the best endings which signifies dual meanings..one of them really takes the film to a gr8r level..1 gr8 visually stunning movie...Bertoluccis best till date

name: 1010792-its_a_wonderful_life
review: Charming, funny, and even insightful, It's a Wonderful Life is an excellent family movie (especially for the holidays) with some philosophy for those who like to look beyond the surface.

name: 1010792-its_a_wonderful_life
review: The best Christmas film ever. Timeless.

name: 1010792-its_a_wonderful_life
review: A beloved holiday classic, "It's A Wonderful Life" is the annual must-watch film that teaches us the value of life and how each and everyone of us has the ability to positively affect one another.

name: 1010792-its_a_wonderful_life
review: Hands down my favorite holiday movie. It runs the full gamut of human emotion and feelings. It makes you laugh, it makes you cry, one of the best movies of all time.

name: 1010792-its_a_wonderful_life
review: An absolute classic of a film that'll make you feel all warm inside, this is the ultimate feel good film. This film focuses on a loveable man who's life hasn't gone his way and is forever putting other people first. A great story and a spectacular ending that'll leave you feeling all fuzzy inside.

name: 1010792-its_a_wonderful_life
review: Uplifting, inspiring, and downright joyful. Powered by Frank Capra's vital energetic and sensitive direction, and Jimmy Stewart's powerful trademark performance, this is the most beautiful and endlessly rewatchable movie I've seen. A true classic!

name: 1010792-its_a_wonderful_life

review: The heartrending effects of this tragic anti-war classic have been undiminished by time. It's vivid depiction of WWI from the POV of a German soldier, it's technically astounding, spectacular battle scenes, amazingly poignant images and it's damning of fanatical nationalism make it a landmark.

name: 1000642-all_quiet_on_the_western_front
